question: A sells a watch to B at a profit of 33% and B sells it to C at a loss of 20%. If C pays ‚Çπ532, then what was the cost price for A?

B purchased 15 kg apples at the rate of ‚Çπ180 per kg from a wholesaler who uses a weight of 950 grams for the kg weight. B sold all these apples at ‚Çπ180 per kg but used a weight of 750 grams for the kg weight. Find the percentage profit earned by B in the transaction (correct to 2 places of decimal).

Aditya sold article X at a profit of 23% and article Y at a loss of 13%. He earned a profit of ‚Çπ180 in the entire transaction. If article X costs ‚Çπ90 less than article Y, then what is the price of article Y (in ‚Çπ )?

Arun brought 50 kg of rice at a discount of 15% on the marked price. For purchasing bulk quantity, he was given 5 kg of wheat (the marked price of which was 60% the marked price of rice) free of cost. Had the retailer sold both items at their marked price to his other customers, then approximately what would be the profit percentage that the shopkeeper could earn ?

A fruit seller buys 480 bananas for ‚Çπ1,200. Some of these bananas are rotten and hence, they are thrown away. He sells the remaining bananas at ‚Çπ3.5 each and makes a profit of ‚Çπ396. What is the percentage of bananas thrown away?

A tailor buys lining clothes from a wholesale merchant and cheats him by using a measurement tape which is 5 cm longer than the normal tape. The tailor offers the customers at cost price while stitching different garments and uses measurements tape which is 5 cm shorter than the normal tape. The gain percent is:

Rini has mixed two colours 'ùê∂ 1' and 'ùê∂ 2' in the ratio 2 : 3. If the rate of the colour 'ùê∂ 1' is ‚Çπ500 per unit and she is selling the mixture of the two colours at ‚Çπ650 per unit at breakeven price, then what is the rate (in ‚Çπ) per unit of the second colour, that is, 'ùê∂ 2'?
A shopkeeper purchased 1600 mangos at the rate of ‚Çπ120 per dozen. Out of these, he sold 900 mangoes at ‚Çπ15 per mango and the remaining mangoes at ‚Çπ14 per mango. His gain percentage is:

A shopkeeper bought a certain number of apples for Rs.3,600. He sold one - fifth of them at a loss of 10%, one-fourth of the remaining apples at a loss of 5%, and two-third of the rest at a profit of 15%. At what price (in Rs.) should he sell the remaining apples to earn a profit of 27% overall?

A retailer announces a discount of 30% for selling an air-conditioner marked at ‚Çπ92,000. The cost price of the air-conditioner is 70% below the marked price. He offers a further discount of 20% if the buyer presents his membership card of the retailer's store. The profit of the retailer with the membership card scheme is what percentage of the profit of the retailer without the membership card scheme?

A shopkeeper is incurring a loss of cost price of 4 pens while selling 20 pens to Ajay. If the shopkeeper had purchased 20 pens at 10% less price and had sold 20 pens to Ajay at 25% more than the selling price, then how much percentage would he have gained (rounded off to 1 decimal place)?

Ten refrigerators and four mobile phones together cost ‚Çπ2,10,000 while six refrigerators and two mobile phones together cost ‚Çπ1,22,000. The cost (in ‚Çπ) of one refrigerator and two mobile phones is:

Mukesh sells two shirts. The cost price of the first shirt is equal to the selling price of the second shirt. The first shirt is sold at a profit of 20% and the second shirt is sold at a loss of 20%. What is the ratio of the selling price of the first shirt to the cost price of the second shirt?

Akshay has 30 articles, each having the same cost price. He marked the price of each article at 30% above its cost price. He sold 15 of the articles at a discount of 20% each and the remaining 15 articles at a discount of 10% each, thereby gaining a total profit of ‚Çπ630. What was the cost price of each article?

A dishonest dealer is selling sugar at Rs. 40 per kg and pretending that he is selling it at a loss of Rs. 5 per kg but he actually gives 800g instead of 1 kg, using a faulty weight. What is his actual profit or loss percent?
A woman sold her earphone for Rs.2,000 and got a percentage profit equal to the numerical value of cost price. The cost price of the earphone is:

A manufacturer sells an item to a wholesale dealer at a profit of 11%. The wholesaler sells the same to a retailer at a profit of 15%. The retailer in turn sells it to a customer for ‚Çπ17,045, thereby earning a profit of 19%. The cost price of the manufacturer is (consider integral part only) :
Aditya sells two wrist watches from his personal collection for ‚Çπ12,600 each. On the first watch he gains 26% and on the second he loses 10%. Find the overall profit percentage?

Sushant buys goods worth Rs.8000. He gets a discount of 10% on that article. After getting the exemption, he pays tax at the rate of 7.5%. Find the amount he will have to pay for this goods received at his residence, if the shopkeeper charges Rs.200 for home delivery

The difference between the selling prices of some apples, if sold for ‚Çπ12 per apple instead of ‚Çπ9 per apple, is ‚Çπ870. If total cost price of all the apples is ‚Çπ2,320, then find the selling price of one apple if the profit earned is 25%

Joseph bought two woollen jackets for Rs. 2100 and Rs. 3150 respectively. By selling the first at a gain of k% and the second at a loss of k%, he found the selling price of both is the same. What is the value of k?
When an article is sold for Rs.720, there is a profit of x%. When the same article is sold for Rs.750, profit is (x + 5) %. What is the value of x ?
35% of goods were sold at a profit of 65%, while the remaining were sold at x% loss. If the overall loss is 12%, then what is the value of x? (correct to one decimal place)
How many kg of salt costing Rs. 28 per kg must be mixed with 6.6 kg of salt costing Rs. 16 per kg, so that selling the mixture at Rs. 29.90, there is a gain of 15%?
By selling two articles for Rs 800, a person gains the cost price of three articles. The profit percent is:
An article is sold at a certain price. If it is sold at 33 1/3 % of this price, there is a loss of 33 1/3 %. What is the percentage profit when it is sold at 60% of the original selling price?
Sujata sold 25 articles for Rs. 1250 and she incurred a loss of 10%. How many articles should she sell for Rs. 2600 so that she can get a profit of 17% ?

The sum of cost prices of A and B is Rs. 1200. The sum of the selling prices of A and B is Rs. 1390. If the profit of 10% and 20% is obtained on A and B respectively, then find the ratio between the cost prices of A and B

A shopkeeper earns the same percent of profit as well as loss by selling two similar pieces of furniture for Rs 18000 and Rs 10000, respectively. At what price should he sell it to earn a profit of 50%?
A shopkeeper gains 400% on a transaction. If the cost increases by 100% and there is no change in the selling price, then find the ratio between new profit and selling price.
Parikh sold his pen at a profit of Rs 11. He calculated the profit percentage on selling price and found it to be 25%. the cost price (in Rs) of the pen is:
If 20% of the goods are sold at 50% profit, 40% of the goods at 20% loss, 20% of the goods at 5% loss and the remaining at no loss or no profit, then the overall profit percentage is:

Two articles were sold for Rs 2400 each by a shopkeeper. The shopkeeper incurred no profit and no loss on the whole transaction. If one of the two articles sold at a profit of 20%, then what was the loss incurred on the other article?

P sold an article to Q at a profit of 20%. Q sold the same article to R at a loss of 25%. R sold the same article to T at a profit of 50%. If P bought the article at Rs 100, then at what price did T buy that article?

A sold an article on 15% profit for Rs. 1495. He purchased another article whose cost price was equal to that of the first article. He sold this new article at 10% profit. What is the total profit of A ?

The cost prices of article A and article B are Rs. 1200 and Rs. 1600 respectively. The selling price of article A is Rs. 1380 and the total profit after selling both the articles is 25%. What is the profit percentage on the article B ?
An article is sold for Rs 6500 so as to earn a profit of 4%. A second article whose cost price is Rs 3750, is sold at a loss of 4%. What is the overall gain or loss percent in the whole transaction?
A man bought three articles for Rs 3,000 each. He sold the articles respectively at 10% profit, 5% profit and 15% loss. The total percentage profit/loss he earned is:
Two articles are sold for Rs.9,720 each. On one, the seller gains 8% and on the other, he loses 10%. What is his overall gain or loss?
A person sells an article at a profit of 12%. If he had purchased it for 12% less and sold it for Rs.9 less, he would have gained 27%. What is the original cost price of the article?
Sushma bought 6 tables and 12 chairs for Rs.12000. She sold the tables at a profit of 15% and the chairs at a loss of 10%. If her total gain was 300, then the total cost of the tables was:

Abhi bought two articles for Rs.624. He sold one at a loss of 14% and the other at a profit of 14%. If the selling price of both the articles is equal, then the difference between their cost prices (in Rs) is:
The marked price of an article is Rs.315. It is sold for Rs. 288. If there is a loss of 4%, then by what percent above the cost is the article marked?
A person sold an article at a loss of 15%. Had he sold it for Rs. 30.60 more, he would have gained 9%. To gain 10%, he should have sold it for:
A bought 38 kg. Rice at Rs. 54.50/kg, 45 Kg rice at Rs. 62/kg, and 55 kg rice at Rs. 48/kg . He sold the mixture at Rs. 65/kg. His loss or profit percentage is:
Three partners A, B and C share profit and losses in the ratio 3:4:7 If the profit for the year before charging 30% tax is Rs. 1,10,166 What is B‚Äôs share of profit after tax?
A cyclist sells 3 cycles at the loss of Rs. 129 per bicycle and 12 cycles on the profit of 516 per cycle. If the total profit on all the bicycles sold is 15%, then what will be the cost per cycle?

A manufacturer sells the product to a wholesaler at 6% profit, the wholesaler sells the product to a retailer at 8% profit and the retailer sells the product to his customer at 10% profit. The price paid by the customer is Rs 31,482. The cost of the product to the manufacturer is:
The cost of 4 chairs and 3 tables is ‚Çπ2,100 and the cost of 5 chairs and 2 tables is ‚Çπ1,750. Find the cost ( in ‚Çπ) of a chair
A shopkeeper sold his goods at half the list price and thus lost 17%. If he had sold on the listed price, then his gain percentage would be:
Sohan sells sugar at the cost price but uses false weights thus gaining 28% profit. How many grams of sugar is he giving for 3.2 kg sugar?

Two friends A and B started a business by investing ‚Çπ1,50,000 and ‚Çπ2,50,000, respectively. They agreed to distribute their earnings in the same ratio of their investments. After an year, the profit earned was ‚Çπ6,00,000. Each of them added ‚Çπ50,000 to their respective profits and invested in a different project. If this project gave an yield of ‚Çπ4,20,000, then A‚Äôs share in the profit is:

The first shirt is sold at twice the selling price of the second shirt. The first shirt is sold at 8% profit and the second shirt is sold at a 3% loss. What is the overall percentage profit on the shirts (Rounded off to two decimal places)?

Sukhvir purchased some perishable items for sale but 30% of  those items could not be sold and went bad. However, Sukhvir managed to sell the rest of the items at a price that helped him earn an overall profit of 19%. At what percentage above the cost price of each item purchased by Sukhvir did he sell each of the items that did not go bad?
If the difference between the selling prices of an article at profits of 10% and 7% is ‚Çπ6, then the cost price (in ‚Çπ) of the article is
Mayur sold a watch at a profit of 7%. If he had sold it for ‚Çπ1,329 more, he would have gained 57%. Find the cost price (in ‚Çπ) of the watch.
After deducing a commission of 20%, a DVD set costs ‚Çπ9,080. Its marked price is:
A dealer sells his goods at 10% loss on the cost price but uses 25% less weight. What is his profit percentage ?
Avi sold a house to Bhargav at a gain of 10% and Bhargav sold it to Chetan at a gain of 20%. If Chetan paid ‚Çπ2,64,00,000 for it, then at what price must Avi have purchased it ?

A vendor marked the selling price of a table at ‚Çπ5,670 after adding 35% profit to its cost price. Since the sale was very low at this price level, he decided to sell the table with 12% profit. Find the new selling price (in ‚Çπ)
The price of a land passing through three hands rises on the whole by 65%. The first and second sellers earned 20% and 25% profit, respectively. Find the profit percentage earned by the third seller.
By selling 42 m of cloth, Vijay gains the selling price of 7 m of cloth. Find the profit percentage.
A shopkeeper increases the cost price of an item by 50% and offers a discount of 40% on this marked price. What is his loss percentage ?
Mihir buys a book for ‚Çπ625. However, because of certain urgency, he sells it for ‚Çπ550. Find his loss percentage.
Mahesh agreed to sell rice with 24% loss, as the rice got rotten. However, he cheated customers and gave only 19 gm of rice in place of 50 gm of rice. What is the percentage of his profit or loss ?
By selling a table for ‚Çπ1,596, Aarav loses 24%. At what price (in ‚Çπ) should he sell it to gain 24%?
Arbind has 650 kg of wheat. A part of which he sells at 9% profit and the rest at 19% profit to get 15% profit on the whole. What is the quantity (in kg) of wheat sold by Arbind at 9% profit?
A person sold two cars for ‚Çπ60,000 each. On one, he gained 20% while on the other he lost 20%. Find the percentage of his gain or losses

A shopkeeper sells sugar at ‚Çπ40 per kg, which he purchased at ‚Çπ36 per kg. His weighing machine is faulty and it weighs only 800 gm while selling. His percentage profit (correct to 2 decimal places) is:

Ankita sold three toys. The first toy was sold for ‚Çπ1,500 at a profit of 25%; the second toy was sold for ‚Çπ2,800 at a loss of 50% and the third toy was sold for ‚Çπ3,500 at a profit of 25%. Find her total profit or loss percentage
Raju sold an article to Ravi at 10% gain. Ravi sold the article to Ramu at a loss of 10%. If Ramu paid ‚Çπ1,485 to Ravi, find the selling price of Raju to Ravi.
Samridhi sold a gold ring at a loss of 26%. If the cost price of the gold ring is ‚Çπ38,500, what is the selling price of the gold ring?

Shobha purchased a small plot in a residential area for ‚Çπ6,00,000 and sold it to Lakshita at a profit of 20%. Lakshita, in turn, sold it to Dinesh at a loss of 10%. How much did Dinesh pay for the plot ?
The cost price of an article is ‚Çπ1,120. After allowing a discount of ‚Çπ205 a gain of 15% was made, then the marked price of the article is:

A manufacturer earns a profit of 10% on selling his products to a wholesale dealer. The wholesale dealer earns a profit of 15% by selling it to a retailer. The retailer, in turn, earns a profit of 25% from the customer. What is the actual cost of production of an article for which the customer pays ‚Çπ12,650 ?
By selling a TV set for ‚Çπ16,800, a salesman gains a profit of 20%. If the production cost is increased by 20%, find the new selling price of the set so as to gain 20%.
A grocer purchased 50 kg of sugar at ‚Çπ40 per kg and mixed with 70 kg of sugar at ‚Çπ30 per kg. At what rate should he sell the mixture (per kg) to gain 20%?
The marked price of mustard oil is 10% more than its cost price. At what percentage less than the marked price should it be sold to have no profit and no loss?
A store sells an item for ‚Çπ500, making a profit of 25%. Later, the store reduces the price of the item by 20% to clear out old inventory. What is the new percentage profit or loss for the store?
Vaishali booked a bus ticket for ‚Çπ1,260. Because of her ill health, she had to cancel the ticket. She got a refund of ‚Çπ945 in this process. What is the percentage loss that Vaishali had to face?
Divya bought six candies for a rupee. How many candies for a rupee must she sell to gain 50%?
By selling 8 items, a shopkeeper gains the selling price of 2 items. The gain percentage of the shopkeeper is:

Zeenat earns 20% on an investment, but she loses 10% on other investments. If the two investments are respectively in the ratio of 3 : 5, then what is the percentage gain or loss for Zeenat on the two investments taken together ?
The profit obtained by a vendor on selling goods at ‚Çπ3,200 is equal to the 7/5 of the profit obtained by selling the same goods at ‚Çπ3,000. What is the cost price (in ‚Çπ) of the goods?
By selling a book at some price, Ankita gains 10%. If the book is sold at twice the price, then what will be the gain percentage for Ankita?
The ratio of cost price to selling price of an article is 186 : 206. The profit per cent on it is :

Kavita bought a table at 30% discount on its original price. She sold it with 48% increase on the price she bought it. What is the percentage difference between the new sale price and original price ? If the original price is ‚Çπ8,000, then how much extra money did Kavita get as profit ?
The cost price of an item is ‚Çπ4,850. What is the profit percentage (rounded off to 1 decimal place) if it is sold at ‚Çπ6,680 ?
A man sold his cycle at 17% loss. If he had sold it for ‚Çπ1,056 more, he would have made 5% profit. The cost price of the cycle is

The percentage profit earned by selling an article for ‚Çπ955 is equal to the percentage loss incurred by selling the same article for ‚Çπ845. At what price should the article be sold to make a 6% profit?

Ravi sells a laptop bag to Reeta for ‚Çπ1,920 and he sells another similar laptop bag to Vinay for ‚Çπ1,280. The percentage profit earned in selling the laptop bag to Reeta is equal to the percentage loss in selling the laptop bag to Vinay At what price (in ‚Çπ) should Ravi sell the laptop bag to make a profit of 25%?
If the manufacturer gains 10%, the wholesale dealer gains 12% and the retailer gains 15%, then find the cost production of a table, the retail price of which is ‚Çπ1,771
Robin purchases a fan for ‚Çπ2,000 and later sells it at a loss of 15%. At what price did he sell the fan ?
By investing ‚Çπ12,000 in a scheme, R gets ‚Çπ15,500 back in return. What is his percentage of profit ?
A milk vendor mixes water with milk and by selling the mixture at the cost price be gains, 16 1/4%. Find the ratio of milk to water in the mixture.

A company buys raw materials for ‚Çπ10,000 and manufactures a product that costs an additional ‚Çπ5,000 in labour and overhead. The product is sold to a distributor for ‚Çπ25,000, who marks it up by 20% and sells it to a retailer. The retailer then marks it up by another 25% and sells it to the end customer. What is the overall percentage profit made by the company, distributor, and retailer combined ?
Anil sells a car to Bina at a profit of 20%. Bina sells it to Karan at a profit of 25%. If Karan pays ‚Çπ2,25,000 for it, then, find the CP of the car for Anil .
By selling at a loss of 12% instead of a loss of 18% an article sells for ‚Çπ120 more. Find its CP
Raman buys an article for ‚Çπ1,00,000 and sells it to Mohit for ‚Çπ1,20,000. Mohit again sells the same article to Rashmi for ‚Çπ1,00,000. What is the percentage loss faced by Mohit ?

A seller marked the price of a sofa 25% more than its cost price. If he allows 12% discount on the marked price to the customer, then what is his gain percentage? If the cost price of the sofa is ‚Çπ15,000, then what is his gain money?
Aditya sold two bags for ‚Çπ630 each. On one bag he gains 33% and on the other he losses 33%. Find his gain or loss per cent on the whole transaction.
By selling a calculator for ‚Çπ1,080, there is a loss of 10%, if the article is sold for ‚Çπ1,350, the net result in the transaction is
Some oranges were purchased at ‚Çπ150 per hundred and sold at ‚Çπ24 per dozen. It gave a gain of ‚Çπ1,000. How many oranges were purchased

A medical store owner purchased medicines worth ‚Çπ18,000 from a company. He sold 2/5 part of the medicine at a 35% loss. On which gain, he should sell the rest of the medicines so that he has neither gain nor loss ?
Ramesh purchased a bag for ‚Çπ 1,275 and sold it at a gain of 15% but calculated on the selling price. Find the selling price of the bag.

A microwave and a dish washing machine were sold for ‚Çπ27,000 each. If the microwave was sold at a gain of 25% and the dish washing machine at a loss of 25%. What is the overall profit % or loss% on the entire transaction?
A shopkeeper bought an oven for ‚Çπ25,000 and sold it for ‚Çπ29,500. He spent ‚Çπ1,500 as overheads. What is his loss or gain percentage (rounded off to the nearest integer)?
Atul sells goods to a customer at a profit of P%. If the cost price of the goods for the customer is ‚Çπ1,50,000 and Atul makes a profit of ‚Çπ30,000, then what is the value of P ?

A jewel was sold passing through 3 hands and on the whole, its price is raised by 80%. The first seller earns 20% profit and the second seller earns 25% profit, respectively. Find the percentage of profit earned by the third seller

Praveen sells a study table to Zoya at a loss of 10%, and Zoya sells the study table to Aadarsh at a profit of 25%. If Aadarsh purchased the study table for ‚Çπ2,250, then what was the cost (in ‚Çπ) of the study table for Praveen?

A factory owner earns 12% on the product manufactured by him. The shopkeeper earns 10% profit on the same item. If shopkeeper sells the product for ‚Çπ98.56, then the cost price of the product for the factory owner is ‚Çπ_____.
If a loss is 1/8th of the selling price then the loss percentage is
A shopkeeper marks his goods at 80% more than their cost price and allows a discount of 48% on the marked price. His loss percentage is:
A dishonest shopkeeper professes to sell grains at the cost price, but he uses a weight of 920 gm for 1 kg weight. Find his gain percentage (round up to two decimal places).

In a showroom, the marked prices of various items are displayed in such a manner that after giving a 10% discount to the customers, the owner of the show room earns a profit of 20%. What is the ratio of the marked price and cost price of each item?
A man buys a toy car for ‚Çπ225 and sells it for ‚Çπ210. Find his loss percentage (round up to two decimal places).

A publisher supplies books to a book-seller at 20% discount on the list price of ‚Çπ1,574.80. If the book-seller sells books at the list price and if his expenses for freight etc. are ‚Çπ45.40. Determine his profit.
Manoj marked his goods 30% above the Cost Price and gives a 12% to the discounts to the customers. The profit or loss percentage is :
A shopkeeper marked a product 40% above the cost price and sold the product for ‚Çπ3,780 by giving a discount of 10%. The profit percentage of the shopkeeper is :
S sells an item costing ‚Çπ37,800 to P with 8% profit. P sells it to Q with a 4% loss. At what price (in ‚Çπ) does P sell the item? (Correct to a nearest rupee)
If a man purchases kismis at ‚Çπ320 per kg and sells it at ‚Çπ6 per 25 grams, then his profit / loss percentage is:
The ratio of cost price (CP) and marked price (MP) of an article is 4 : 7. A discount of 20% is given on MP and the shopkeeper made a profit of ‚Çπ80. Find the CP of the article.

In April 2019, Dinesh purchased a new car for ‚Çπ7,00,000 and sold it in April 2022 at its depreciated cost. If the rate of depreciation in the first year is 20%, 15% in the second year and 10% every year thereafter, what amount of money will Dinesh get as the selling price ?

A vendor earns 10% on an investment but loses 10% on another investment. What will be the combined loss or gain if the two investments are in the ratio 1: 3 ?

If the cost price of a book is 92% of its selling price, then what is the percentage profit on the sale of the book (correct up to two decimal places)?

A dealer gives a 7% discount on the marked price and gives 1 article free for buying every 25 articles and thus gains 25%. Find the percentage increase in the marked price above the cost price (round up to two decimal places).

Sukhen purchased some perishable items for sale but 15% of those items could not be sold and went bad. However, Sukhen managed to sell the rest of the items at a price that helped him eam an overall profit of 19%. At what percentage above the cost price of each item did Sukthen sell each of the items that did NOT go bad?
The marked price of a toy car is ‚Çπ600. The shopkeeper gives a discount of 4% and still makes a profit of 28%. Find the cost price of a toy car.
A tradesman marks his goods at such a price that after allowing a discount of 31%, he makes a profit of 15%. What is the marked price of an article whose cost price is ‚Çπ3,420?
An item is sold for ‚Çπ2,744 and the seller earns 12% profit. What should be the selling price (in ‚Çπ ) to earn only 5% profit?
The selling price of 34 articles is equal to the cost price of 38 articles. What is the gain percentage?

A renowned brand marked its goods at 40% above the cost price but allows a discount of 7.5% for UPI payments to the customers. What actual profit is made on a shirt, if a customer pays ‚Çπ1,813 to buy it using UPI ?
The marked price of a T-shirt is ‚Çπ560. The shopkeeper Krishna allows a discount of 16% and gains 12%. What would be the gain of Krishna if no discount is allowed ?

Pawan purchases 70 articles for ‚Çπ16,875 and sells them at a loss equal to the selling price of 5 articles. What will be the selling price of one article?

The marked price of an item is 25% more than that of its cost price. If a discount of 10% is given on the marked price,then the gain percentage is:
A tradesman marks his goods 25% above the cost price and allows his customers a discount of 12% on their bill. How much % profit tradesman realizes ?
A man sells a good at 5% profit. If he had sold it at a 10% profit, he would have received ‚Çπ175 more. What is the selling price of the good ?
The cost price of 240 articles is the same as the selling price of x articles. If profit is 20%, find the value of x.
The marked price of a school bag was ‚Çπ 550. This price was 10% above the cost price. It was sold at a discount of 10% on the marked price. Find the gain or loss percentage.

The marked price of 85 items was equal to the cost price of 153 items. The selling price of 104 items was equal to the marked price of 65 items. Calculate the percentage profit from the sale of each item.
